title: Mark Clattenburg 'to earn £500,000-a-year TAX FREE' in Saudi Arabia
text:
Clattenburg is set to earn big money in Saudi Arabia (Photo: Laurence Griffiths)   Thank you for subscribing!   
Mark Clattenburg will reportedly earn £500,000-a-year tax free in his new job as a refereeing chief in Saudi Arabia. 
Top whistler Clattenburg has quit his role as a Premier League match official to take up the post, and will double his earnings in the Middle East, according to The Sun. 
Clattenburg will also receive numerous other benefits after apparently becoming disillusioned with ref bosses in England. 
He is said to be upset by the perceived lack of support he received after being accused of abusing Chelsea midfielder John Obi Mikel in 2012. Clattenburg has quit his job in the Prem (Photo: AFP/Getty) He has taken up a new role in the Middle East (Photo: REUTERS) 
Clattenburg was alleged to have called Mikel a 'monkey' but was cleared of any wrongdoing after an FA investigation. 
Former ref Mike Halsey wrote in his Sun column: “It’s disturbing that it has come to this. Why is our best referee leaving the Premier League? 
“The blame lies firmly with Mike Riley. Mark was totally disillusioned with Mike and his management team. He felt there was a lack of support.
